jsdp.utilities.probdist

Class SafeMultinomialDist

  • java.lang.Object
    • umontreal.ssj.probdistmulti.DiscreteDistributionIntMulti
      • umontreal.ssj.probdistmulti.MultinomialDist
        • jsdp.utilities.probdist.SafeMultinomialDist

  • public class SafeMultinomialDist
extends umontreal.ssj.probdistmulti.MultinomialDist
    A "safe" implementation of a MultinomialDist; this implementation rather than throwing an exception, returns a probability 0.0 for states that are outside the multinomial support (i.e. states with negative values).
    Author:
    Roberto Rossi

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class umontreal.ssj.probdistmulti.MultinomialDist

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SafeMultinomialDist(int n, double[] p)
      Creates a `MultinomialDist` object with parameters @f$n@f$ and (@f$p_1@f$,…,@f$p_d@f$) such that @f$\sum_{i=1}^d p_i = 1@f$.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SafeMultinomialDist

        public SafeMultinomialDist(int n,
                           double[] p)
        Creates a `MultinomialDist` object with parameters @f$n@f$ and (@f$p_1@f$,…,@f$p_d@f$) such that @f$\sum_{i=1}^d p_i = 1@f$. We have @f$p_i = @f$ `p[i-1]`.
        Parameters:
        n - number of trials
        p - multinomial probabilities
